    "additions": 0,
    "deletions": 100,
    "changes": 100,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-permission-analytics.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-permission-analytics.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-permission-analytics.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,100 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Create and view permission analytics triggers in Permissions Management\n-description: How to create and view permission analytics triggers in the Permission analytics tab in Permissions Management.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-# Create and view permission analytics triggers\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-This article describes how you can create and view permission analytics triggers in Permissions Management.\n-\n-## View permission analytics triggers\n-You can view permission analytics triggers to monitor activities in Permissions Management. This section explains how to access and interpret the alerts.\n-\n-1. In the Permissions Management home page, select **Activity triggers** (the bell icon).\n-1. Select **Permission Analytics**, and then select the **Alerts** subtab.\n-\n-    The **Alerts** subtab displays the following information:\n-\n-      - **Alert Name**: Lists the name of the alert.\n-           - To view the name, ID, role, domain, authorization system, statistical condition, anomaly date, and observance period, select **Alert name**.\n-           - To expand the top information found with a graph of when the anomaly occurred, select **Details**.\n-      - **Anomaly Alert Rule**: Displays the name of the rule select when creating the alert.\n-      - **# of Occurrences**: Displays how many times the alert trigger has occurred.\n-      - **Task**: Displays how many tasks are affected by the alert\n-      - **Resources**: Displays how many resources are affected by the alert\n-      - **Identity**: Displays how many identities are affected by the alert\n-      - **Authorization System**: Displays which authorization systems the alert applies to\n-      - **Date/Time**: Displays the date and time of the alert.\n-      - **Date/Time (UTC)**: Lists the date and time of the alert in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).\n-\n-1. To filter the alerts, select the appropriate alert name or, from the **Alert Name** menu,select **All**.\n-\n-      - From the **Date** dropdown menu, select **Last 24 Hours**, **Last 2 Days**, **Last Week**, or **Custom Range**, and then select **Apply**.\n-\n-        If you select **Custom range**, select date and time settings, and then select **Apply**.      - **View Trigger**: Displays the current trigger settings and applicable authorization system details.\n-\n-1. To view the following details, select the ellipses (**...**):\n-\n-      - **Details**: Displays **Authorization System Type**, **Authorization Systems**, **Resources**, **Tasks**, and **Identities** that matched the alert criteria.\n-1. To view specific matches, select **Resources**, **Tasks**, or **Identities**.\n-\n-   The **Activity** section displays details about the **Identity Name**, **Resource Name**, **Task Name**, **Date**, and **IP Address**.\n-\n-## Create a permission analytics trigger\n-You can create permission analytics triggers to detect specific activities. This section guides you through the steps to create these triggers.\n-\n-1. In the Permissions Management home page, select **Activity triggers** (the bell icon).\n-1. Select **Permission Analytics**, select the **Alerts** subtab, and then select **Create Permission Analytics Trigger**.\n-1. In the **Alert Name** box,  enter a name for the alert.\n-1. Select the **Authorization System**.\n-1. Select **Identity performed high number of tasks**, and then select **Next**.\n-1. On the **Authorization Systems** tab, select the appropriate accounts and folders, or select **All**.\n-\n-    This screen defaults to the **List** view but can also be changed to the **Folder** view, and the applicable folder can be selected instead of individually by system.\n-\n-    - The **Status** column displays if the authorization system is online or offline\n-    - The **Controller** column displays if the controller is enabled or disabled.\n-1. Select **Save**.\n-\n-## View permission analytics alert triggers\n-You can view and manage the permission analytics alert triggers you have created. This section provides instructions on how to access and modify these triggers.\n-\n-1. In the Permissions Management home page, select **Activity triggers** (the bell icon).\n-1. Select **Permission Analytics**, and then select the **Alert Triggers** subtab.\n-\n-    The **Alert triggers** subtab displays the following information:\n-\n-      - **Alert**: Lists the name of the alert.\n-      - **Anomaly Alert Rule**: Displays the name of the rule select when creating the alert.\n-      - **# of users subscribed**: Displays the number of users subscribed to the alert.\n-      - **Created By**: Displays the email address of the user who created the alert.\n-      - **Last modified By**: Displays the email address of the user who last modified the alert.\n-      - **Last Modified On**: Displays the date and time the trigger was last modified.\n-      - **Subscription**: Toggle the button to **On** or **Off**.\n-      - **View Trigger**: Displays the current trigger settings and applicable authorization system details.\n-\n-1. To view other options available to you, select the ellipses (**...**), and then make a selection from the available options:\n-\n-      - **Details** displays **Authorization System Type**, **Authorization Systems**, **Resources**, **Tasks**, and **Identities** that matched the alert criteria.\n-      - To view the specific matches, select **Resources**, **Tasks**, or **Identities**.\n-      - The **Activity** section displays details about the **Identity Name**, **Resource Name**, **Task Name**, **Date**, and **IP Address**.\n-\n-1. To filter by **Activated** or **Deactivated**, in the **Status** section, select **All**, **Activated**, or **Deactivated**, and then select **Apply**.\n-\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- For an overview on activity triggers, see [View information about activity triggers](ui-triggers.md).\n-- For information on activity alerts and alert triggers, see [Create and view activity alerts and alert triggers](how-to-create-alert-trigger.md).\n-- For information on rule-based anomalies and anomaly triggers, see [Create and view rule-based anomalies and anomaly triggers](product-rule-based-anomalies.md).\n-- For information on finding outliers in identity's behavior, see [Create and view statistical anomalies and anomaly triggers](product-statistical-anomalies.md)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "efec0958fd564eb717efb66d2bd7546a7755681b",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/product-permissions-analytics-reports.md",
    "status": "removed",
    "additions": 0,
    "deletions": 109,
    "changes": 109,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-permissions-analytics-reports.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-permissions-analytics-reports.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-permissions-analytics-reports.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,109 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: View and download the Permissions Analytics Report in Permissions Management\n-description: How to view and download the Permissions Analytics Report in Permissions Management.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-# View and download the Permissions analytics report\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-This article describes how to view and download the **Permissions analytics report** in Permissions Management for AWS, Azure, and GPC authorization systems.\n-\n->[!NOTE]\n->The Permissions analytics report can be downloaded in Excel and PDF formats.\n-\n-## View the Permissions Analytics Report in the Permissions Management UI\n-\n-You can view the Permissions Analytics Report information directly in the Permissions Management UI.\n-\n-1. In Permissions Management, select **Reports** in the navigation menu.\n-2. Locate the **Permissions Analytics Report** in the list, then select it.\n-3. View detailed report information from the list of categories that are displayed.\n-   >[!NOTE]\n-   > Categories will vary depending on which Authorization System you are viewing.\n-\n-4. To view more detailed information into each category, select the drop-down arrow next to the category name.\n-\n-\n-## Download the Permissions Analytics Report in Excel format\n-\n-1. From the Permissions Management home page, select the **Reports** tab, then select the **Systems Reports** subtab.\n-    \n-    The **Systems Reports** subtab displays a list of report names in the **Reports** table.\n-2. Locate the **Permissions Analytics Report** in the list.\n-3. To download the report in Excel format, click on the ellipses **(...)**, the select **Generate & Download**.\n-    \n-    The Permissions Analytics Report screen is displayed.\n-4. Click on **Report Format** and make sure that **XLSX** is selected.\n-5. Click on **Schedule** and, if you want to download this report regularly, select the frequency for which you want it downloaded. You can also leave this at the default setting of **None**.\n-6. Click on **Authorization Systems** and select which system you want to download the report for (AWS, Azure, or GCP).\n-   >[!NOTE]\n-   > To download a report for all Authorization Systems, check the **Collate** box. This combines all selected Authorization Systems into one report.\n-7. Click **Save**\n-\n-    The following message displays: **Report has been created**.\n-\n-    Once the Excel file is generated, the report is automatically sent to your email.\n-\n-## Download the Permissions Analytics Report in PDF format\n-\n-1. From the Permissions Management home page, select the **Reports** tab, then select the **Systems Reports** subtab.\n-    \n-    The **Systems Reports** subtab displays a list of reports names in the **Reports** table.\n-2. Locate the **Permissions Analytics Report** in the list, then select it.\n-3. Select which Authorization System you want to generate the PDF download for (AWS, Azure, or GCP).\n-   >[!NOTE]\n-   >You can download a PDF report for up to 10 authorization systems at one time. The authorization systems must be part of the same cloud environment (for example, 1- 10 authorization systems that are all on Amazon Web Service (AWS)). \n-    \n-    The following message displays: **Successfully started to generate PDF report**. \n-    \n-    Once the PDF is generated, the report(s) is automatically sent to your email.\n-\n-## Terminology and definitions\n-\n-This list of terms and definitions are here to assist you in understanding the different types of identities and their privileges while viewing analytics reports. \n-\n-| Term | Definition | \n-| ------ | ------ | \n-| Granted permissions | The number of permissions granted due to directly attached policies, policies inherited from a group, and policies attached to a role that are assumed by an identity. |\n-| High-risk permission | Permissions that have the potential to cause data leakage, service disruption and degradation, or changes in security posture. |\n-| Identity | An identity is a human identity (user) or workload identity. There are different names and types of workload identities for each cloud. AWS: Lambda function (serverless function), role, resource. Azure: Azure function (serverless function), service principal. GCP: Cloud function (serverless function), service account. |\n-| Inactive group | Inactive groups have members who haven't used their granted permissions in the current environment (I.e. AWS Account)  in the last 90 days.    |\n-| Inactive identity | Inactive identities haven't used their granted permissions in the current environment (i.e. AWS Account) the last 90 days. |\n-| Over-provisioned active identity | Over-provisioned active identities aren't using all the permissions they've been granted in the current environment. |  \n-| Permission | A permission is an action an identity can perform on a resource. |\n-| Privilege escalation | Identities with privilege escalation can increase the number of permissions they've been granted. They can do this to potentially acquire full administrative control of the AWS account or GCP project. |\n-| Super identity | Super identities are granted permissions to all actions and resources in the current environment (i.e. AWS account). |\n-| Used permissions | The number of permissions used by an identity in the last 90 days. |\n-\n-<!---## Add and remove tags in the Permissions analytics report\n-\n-1. Select **Tags**.\n-1. Select one of the categories from the **Permissions Analytics Report**.\n-1. Select the identity name to which you want to add a tag. Then, select the checkbox at the top to select all identities.\n-1. Select **Add Tag**.\n-1. In the **Tag** column:\n-    - To select from the available options from the list, select **Select a Tag**.\n-    - To search for a tag, enter the tag name.\n-    - To create a new custom tag, select  **New Custom Tag**.\n-    - To create a new tag, enter a name for the tag and select **Create**.\n-    - To remove a tag, select **Delete**.\n-\n-1. In the **Value (optional)** box, enter a value, if necessary.\n-1. Select **Save**.--->\n-\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- For information on how to view system reports in the **Reports** dashboard, see [View system reports in the Reports dashboard](product-reports.md).\n-- For a detailed overview of available system reports, see [View a list and description of system reports](all-reports.md).\n-- For information about how to generate and view a system report, see [Generate and view a system report](report-view-system-report.md).\n-- For information about how to create, view, and share a system report, see [Create, view, and share a custom report](report-view-system-report.md)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "6d15f820132f1472b0bfc43f849fc12361d59b32",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/product-privileged-role-insights.md",
    "status": "removed",
    "additions": 0,
    "deletions": 39,
    "changes": 39,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-privileged-role-insights.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-privileged-role-insights.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-privileged-role-insights.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,39 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: View privileged role assignments in Microsoft Entra Insights\n-description: How to view current privileged role assignments in the Microsoft Entra Insights tab.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n-ms.custom: sfi-ga-nochange\n----\n-\n-# View privileged role assignments in your organization\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-The **Microsoft Entra Insights** tab shows you who is assigned to [privileged roles](/entra/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference) in your organization. You can review a list of identities assigned to a privileged role and learn more about each identity.\n-\n-> [!NOTE] \n-> Keep role assignments permanent if a user has an additional Microsoft account (for example, an account they use to sign in to Microsoft services like Skype or Outlook.com). If you require multi-factor authentication to activate a role assignment, a user with an additional Microsoft account will be locked out.  \n-\n-[!INCLUDE [emergency-access-accounts](../includes/definitions/emergency-access-accounts.md)]\n-\n-## Prerequisite\n-To view information on the Microsoft Entra Insights tab, you must have [Permissions Management Administrator](/entra/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference#permissions-management-administrator) role permissions.\n-\n-<a name='view-information-in-the-azure-ad-insights-tab'></a>\n-\n-## View information in the Microsoft Entra Insights tab\n-\n-1. From the Permissions Management home page, select the **Microsoft Entra Insights** tab.\n-2. Select **Review Global Administrators** to review the list of Global Administrator role assignments.\n-3. Select **Review highly privileged roles** or **Review service principals** to review information on principal role assignments for the following roles: *Application Administrator*, *Cloud Application Administrator*, *Exchange Administrator*, *Intune Administrator*, *Privileged Role Administrator*, *SharePoint Administrator*, *Security Administrator*, *User Administrator*. \n-\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- For information about managing roles, policies and permissions requests in your organization, see [View roles/policies and requests for permission in the Remediation dashboard](ui-remediation.md)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "61f75555e6b57564dc72416b170237241d44e6c9",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/product-reports.md",
    "status": "removed",
    "additions": 0,
    "deletions": 124,
    "changes": 124,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-reports.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-reports.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-reports.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,124 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: View system reports in the Reports dashboard in Permissions Management\n-description: How to view system reports in the Reports dashboard in Permissions Management.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-# View system reports in the Reports dashboard\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-Permissions Management has various types of system report types available that capture specific sets of data. These reports allow management to:\n-\n-- Make timely decisions.\n-- Analyze trends and system/user performance.\n-- Identify trends in data and high risk areas so that management can address issues more quickly and improve their efficiency.\n-\n-## Explore the Reports dashboard\n-\n-The **Reports** dashboard provides a table of information with both system reports and custom reports. The **Reports** dashboard defaults to the **System Reports** tab, which has the following details:\n-\n-- **Report Name**: The name of the report.\n-- **Category**: The type of report. For example, **Permission**.\n-- **Authorization Systems**: Displays which authorizations the custom report applies to.\n-- **Format**: Displays the output format the report can be generated in. For example, comma-separated values (CSV) format, portable document format (PDF), or Microsoft Excel Open XML Spreadsheet (XLSX) format.\n-\n-    - To download a report, select the down arrow to the right of the report name, or from the ellipses **(...)** menu, select **Download**.\n-\n-      The following message displays across the top of the screen in green if the download is successful: **Successfully Started To Generate On Demand Report**.\n-\n-## Available system reports\n-\n-Permissions Management offers the following reports for management associated with the authorization systems noted in parentheses:\n-\n-- **Access Key Entitlements And Usage**:\n-    - **Summary of report**: Provides information about access key, for example, permissions, usage, and rotation date.\n-    - **Applies to**: Amazon Web Services (AWS) and Microsoft Azure\n-    - **Report output type**: CSV\n-    - **Ability to collate report**: Yes\n-    - **Type of report**: **Summary** or **Detailed**\n-    - **Use cases**:\n-        - The access key age, last rotation date, and last usage date is available in the summary report to help with key rotation.\n-        - The granted task and Permissions creep index (PCI) score to take action on the keys.\n-\n-- **User Entitlements And Usage**:\n-    - **Summary of report**: Provides information about the identities' permissions, for example, entitlement, usage, and PCI.\n-    - **Applies to**: AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud Platform (GCP)\n-    - **Report output type**: CSV\n-    - **Ability to collate report**: Yes\n-    - **Type of report**: **Summary** or **Detailed**\n-    - **Use cases**:\n-         - The data displayed on the **Usage Analytics** screen is downloaded as part of the **Summary** report. The user's detailed permissions usage is listed in the **Detailed** report.\n-\n-- **Group Entitlements And Usage**:\n-    - **Summary of report**: Provides information about the group's permissions, for example, entitlement, usage, and PCI.\n-    - **Applies to**: AWS, Azure, and GCP\n-    - **Report output type**: CSV\n-    - **Ability to collate report**: Yes\n-    - **Type of report**: **Summary**\n-    - **Use cases**:\n-         - All group level entitlements and permission assignments, PCIs, and the number of members are listed as part of this report.\n-\n-- **Identity Permissions**:\n-    - **Summary of report**: Report on identities that have specific permissions, for example, identities that have permission to delete any S3 buckets.\n-    - **Applies to**: AWS, Azure, and GCP\n-    - **Report output type**: CSV\n-    - **Ability to collate report**: No\n-    - **Type of report**: **Summary**\n-    - **Use cases**:\n-         - Any task usage or specific task usage via User/Group/Role/App can be tracked with this report.\n-\n-- **Permissions Analytics Report**\n-    - **Summary of report**: Provides information about the violation of key security best practices.\n-    - **Applies to**: AWS, Azure, and GCP\n-    - **Report output type**: XSLX, PDF\n-    - **Ability to collate report**: Yes (XSLX only)\n-    - **Type of report**: **Detailed**\n-    - **Use cases**:\n-         - This report lists the different key findings in the selected auth systems. The key findings include super identities, inactive identities, over provisioned active identities, storage bucket hygiene, and access key age (for AWS only). The report helps administrators to visualize the findings across the organization.\n-\n-    For more information about this report, see [Permissions analytics report](product-permissions-analytics-reports.md).\n-\n-- **Role/Policy Details**\n-    - **Summary of report**: Provides information about roles and policies.\n-    - **Applies to**: AWS, Azure, GCP\n-    - **Report output type**: CSV\n-    - **Ability to collate report**: No\n-    - **Type of report**: **Summary**\n-    - **Use cases**:\n-         - Assigned/Unassigned, custom/system policy, and the used/unused condition is captured in this report for any specific, or all, AWS accounts. Similar data can be captured for Azure/GCP for the assigned/unassigned roles.\n-\n-- **PCI History**\n-    - **Summary of report**: Provides a report of privilege creep index (PCI) history.\n-    - **Applies to**: AWS, Azure, GCP\n-    - **Report output type**: CSV\n-    - **Ability to collate report**: Yes\n-    - **Type of report**: **Summary**\n-    - **Use cases**:\n-         - This report plots the trend of the PCI by displaying the monthly PCI history for each authorization system.\n-\n-- **All Permissions for Identity**\n-    - **Summary of report**: Provides results of all permissions for identities.\n-    - **Applies to**: AWS, Azure, GCP\n-    - **Report output type**: CSV\n-    - **Ability to collate report**: Yes\n-    - **Type of report**: **Summary**\n-    - **Use cases**:\n-         - This report lists all the assigned permissions for the selected identities.\n-\n-\n-\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- For a detailed overview of available system reports, see [View a list and description of system reports](all-reports.md).\n-- For information about how to create, view, and share a system report, see [Create, view, and share a custom report](report-view-system-report.md).\n-- For information about how to create and view a custom report, see [Generate and view a custom report](report-create-custom-report.md).\n-- For information about how to create and view the Permissions analytics report, see [Generate and download the Permissions analytics report](product-permissions-analytics-reports.md)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "5907442e210e88ed6eda83d3c66964b8fb598d84",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/product-roles-permissions.md",
    "status": "removed",
    "additions": 0,
    "deletions": 69,
    "changes": 69,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-roles-permissions.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-roles-permissions.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-roles-permissions.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,69 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Microsoft Entra Permissions Management roles and permissions\n-description: Review roles and the level of permissions assigned in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n-ms.custom: sfi-ga-nochange\n-# customerintent: As a cloud administrator, I want to understand Permissions Management role assignments, so that I can effectively assign the correct permissions to users.\n----\n-\n-\n-# Microsoft Entra Permissions Management roles and permissions levels\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-In Microsoft Azure and Microsoft Entra Permissions Management role assignments grant users permissions to monitor and take action in multicloud environments.\n-\n-- **Global Administrator**: Manages all aspects of Microsoft Entra admin center and Microsoft services that use Microsoft Entra admin center identities. \n-- **Permissions Management Administrator**: Manages all aspects of Microsoft Entra Permissions Management.\n-- **Billing Administrator**: Performs common billing related tasks like updating payment information. \n- \n-\n-See [Microsoft Entra built-in roles to learn more.](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2247090)\n-\n-## Enabling Permissions Management\n-- To activate a trial or purchase a license, you must have [Billing Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#billing-administrator) permissions.\n-\n-## Onboarding your Amazon Web Service (AWS), Microsoft Entra, or Google Cloud Platform (GCP) environments\n-\n-- To configure data collection, you must be a [Permissions Management Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#permissions-management-administrator). \n-- A user with the [Permissions Management Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#permissions-management-administrator) role is required for AWS and GCP onboarding.\n-\n-## Notes on permissions and roles in Permissions Management\n-\n-- Users can have the following permissions:\n-    - Admin for all authorization system types\n-    - Admin for selected authorization system types\n-    - Fine-grained permissions for all or selected authorization system types\n-- If a user isn't an admin, they're assigned Microsoft Entra security group-based, fine-grained permissions for all or selected authorization system types:\n-    - Viewers: View the specified AWS accounts, Azure subscriptions, and GCP projects\n-    - Controller: Modify Cloud Infrastructure Entitlement Management (CIEM) properties and use the Remediation dashboard.\n-    - Approvers: Able to approve permission requests\n-    - Requestors: Request permissions in the specified AWS accounts, Microsoft Entra subscriptions, and GCP projects.\n-\n-## Permissions Management actions and required roles\n-\n-Remediation\n-- To view the **Remediation** tab, you must have *Viewer*, *Controller*, or *Approver* permissions.\n-- To make changes in the **Remediation** tab, you must have *Controller* or *Approver* permissions.\n-\n-Autopilot\n-- To view and make changes in the **Autopilot** tab, you must be a *Permissions Management Administrator*.\n-\n-Alert\n-- Any user (admin, nonadmin) can create an alert. \n-- Only the user who creates the alert can edit, rename, deactivate, or delete the alert.\n-\n-Manage users or groups\n-- Only the owner of a group can add or remove a user from the group.\n-- Managing users and groups is only done in the Microsoft Entra admin center.\n-\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-For information about managing roles, policies and permissions requests in your organization, see [View roles/policies and requests for permission in the Remediation dashboard](ui-remediation.md)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "4266f11d72c6542a473f86f7fc0026649e78c632",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/product-rule-based-anomalies.md",
    "status": "removed",
    "additions": 0,
    "deletions": 130,
    "changes": 130,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-rule-based-anomalies.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-rule-based-anomalies.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-rule-based-anomalies.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,130 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Create and view rule-based anomaly alerts and alert triggers in Permissions Management\n-description: How to create and view rule-based anomaly alerts and alert triggers in Permissions Management.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-# Create and view rule-based anomaly alerts and alert triggers\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-Rule-based anomalies identify recent activity in Permissions Management that is determined to be unusual based on explicit rules defined in the alert trigger. The goal of rule-based anomaly alerts is high-precision detection.\n-\n-You can configure rule-based anomaly alert triggers for the following conditions:\n-- **Any Resource Accessed for the First Time**: The identity accesses a resource for the first time during the specified time interval.\n-- **Identity Performs a Particular Task for the First Time**: The identity does a specific task for the first time during the specified time interval.\n-- **Identity Performs a Task for the First Time**: The identity performs any task for the first time during the specified time interval.\n-\n-Alert triggers are based on data collected. All alerts, if triggered, are shown every hour under the Alerts subtab.\n-\n-## View rule-based anomaly alerts\n-You can view rule-based anomaly alerts to monitor unusual activities in Permissions Management. This section explains how to access and interpret the alerts.\n-\n-1. In the Permissions Management home page, select **Alerts** (the bell icon).\n-1. Select **Rule-Based Anomaly**, and then select the **Alerts** subtab.\n-\n-    The **Alerts** subtab displays the following information:\n-\n-      - **Alert Name**: Lists the name of the alert.\n-\n-      - To view the specific identity, resource, and task names that occurred during the alert collection period, select the **Alert Name**.\n-\n-      - **Anomaly Alert Rule**: Displays the name of the rule select when creating the alert.\n-      - **# of Occurrences**: How many times the alert trigger has occurred.\n-      - **Task**: How many tasks performed are triggered by the alert.\n-      - **Resources**: How many resources accessed are triggered by the alert.\n-      - **Identity**: How many identities performing unusual behavior are triggered by the alert.\n-      - **Authorization System**: Displays which authorization systems the alert applies to, Amazon Web Services (**AWS**), Microsoft **Azure**, or Google Cloud Platform (**GCP**).\n-      - **Date/Time**: Lists the date and time of the alert.\n-      - **Date/Time (UTC)**: Lists the date and time of the alert in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).\n-\n-\n-1. To filter alerts:\n-\n-    - From the **Alert Name** dropdown, select **All** or the appropriate alert name.\n-    - From the **Date** dropdown menu, select **Last 24 Hours**, **Last 2 Days**, **Last Week**, or **Custom Range**, and select **Apply**.\n-\n-     - If you select **Custom Range**, also enter **From** and **To** duration settings.\n-1. To view details that match the alert criteria, select the ellipses (**...**).\n-\n-     - **View Trigger**: Displays the current trigger settings and applicable authorization system details\n-     - **Details**: Displays details about **Authorization System Type**, **Authorization Systems**, **Resources**, **Tasks**, **Identities**, and **Activity**\n-     - **Activity**: Displays details about the **Identity Name**, **Resource Name**, **Task Name**, **Date/Time**, **Inactive For**, and **IP Address**. Selecting the \"eye\" icon displays the **Raw Events Summary**\n-\n-## Create a rule-based anomaly alert trigger\n-You can configure rule-based anomaly alert triggers for specific conditions to detect unusual activities. This section guides you through the steps to create these alert triggers.\n-\n-1. In the Permissions Management home page, select **Alerts** (the bell icon).\n-1. Select **Rule-Based Anomaly**, and then select the **Alerts** subtab.\n-1. Select **Create Alert Trigger**.\n-\n-1. In the **Alert Name** box, enter a name for the alert.\n-1. Select the **Authorization System**, **AWS**, **Azure**, or **GCP**.\n-1. Select one of the following conditions:\n-      - **Any Resource Accessed for the First Time**: The identity accesses a resource for the first time during the specified time interval.\n-      - **Identity Performs a Particular Task for the First Time**: The identity does a specific task for the first time during the specified time interval.\n-      - **Identity Performs a Task for the First Time**: The identity performs any task for the first time during the specified time interval.\n-1. Select **Next**.\n-1. On the **Authorization Systems** tab, select the available authorization systems and folders, or select **All**.\n-\n-    This screen defaults to **List** view, but you can change it to **Folders** view. You can select the applicable folder instead of individually selecting by authorization system.\n-\n-      - The **Status** column displays if the authorization system is online or offline.\n-      - The **Controller** column displays if the controller is enabled or disabled.\n-\n-1. On the **Configuration** tab, to update the **Time Interval**, select **90 Days**, **60 Days**, or **30 Days** from the **Time range** dropdown.\n-1. Select **Save**.\n-\n-## View a rule-based anomaly alert trigger\n-You can view and manage the rule-based anomaly alert triggers you have created. This section provides instructions on how to access and modify these triggers.\n-\n-1. In the Permissions Management home page, select **Alerts** (the bell icon).\n-1. Select **Rule-Based Anomaly**, and then select the **Alert Triggers** subtab.\n-\n-    The **Alert Triggers** subtab displays the following information:\n-\n-      - **Alerts**: Displays the name of the alert.\n-      - **Anomaly Alert Rule**: Displays the name of the selected rule when creating the alert.\n-      - **# of Users Subscribed**: Displays the number of users subscribed to the alert.\n-      - **Created By**: Displays the email address of the user who created the alert.\n-      - **Last Modified By**: Displays the email address of the user who last modified the alert.\n-      - **Last Modified On**: Displays the date and time the trigger was last modified.\n-      - **Subscription**: Subscribes you to receive alert emails. Switches between **On** and **Off**.\n-\n-1. To view other options available to you, select the ellipses (**...**), and then select from the available options:\n-\n-    If the **Subscription** is **On**, the following options are available:\n-\n-    - **Edit**: Enables you to modify alert parameters.\n-\n-       Only the user who created the alert can edit the trigger screen, rename an alert, deactivate an alert, and delete an alert. Changes made by other users aren't saved.\n-\n-    - **Duplicate**: Create a duplicate copy of the selected alert trigger.\n-    - **Rename**: Enter the new name of the query, and then select **Save.**\n-    - **Deactivate**: The alert will still be listed, but will no longer send emails to subscribed users.\n-    - **Activate**: Activate the alert trigger and start sending emails to subscribed users.\n-    - **Notification Settings**: View the **Email** of users who are subscribed to the alert trigger.\n-    - **Delete**: Delete the alert.\n-\n-    If the **Subscription** is **Off**, the following options are available:\n-    - **View**: View  details of the alert trigger.\n-    - **Notification Settings**: View the **Email** of users who are subscribed to the alert trigger.\n-    - **Duplicate**: Create a duplicate copy of the selected alert trigger.\n-\n-1. To filter by **Activated** or **Deactivated**, in the **Status** section, select **All**, **Activated**, or **Deactivated**, and then select **Apply**.\n-\n-\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- For an overview on alerts and alert triggers, see [View information about alerts and alert triggers](ui-triggers.md).\n-- For information on activity alerts and alert triggers, see [Create and view activity alerts and alert triggers](how-to-create-alert-trigger.md).\n-- For information on finding outliers in identity's behavior, see [Create and view statistical anomaly alerts and alert triggers](product-statistical-anomalies.md).\n-- For information on permission analytics alerts and alert triggers, see [Create and view permission analytics alerts and alert triggers](product-permission-analytics.md)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "98ddb56ac02a3ed98f4726e1823627317b68e0d4",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/product-statistical-anomalies.md",
    "status": "removed",
    "additions": 0,
    "deletions": 135,
    "changes": 135,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-statistical-anomalies.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-statistical-anomalies.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fproduct-statistical-anomalies.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,135 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Create and view statistical anomaly alerts and alert triggers in Permissions Management\n-description: How to create and view statistical anomaly alerts and alert triggers in the Statistical Anomaly tab in Permissions Management.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-# Create and view statistical anomaly alerts and alert triggers\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-Statistical anomalies can detect outliers in an identity's behavior if the recent activity is determined to be unusual based on models defined in an activity trigger. The goal of this alert trigger is a high recall rate.\n-\n-You can configure statistical anomaly alert triggers for the following scenarios:\n-- **Identity Performed High Number of Tasks**: The identity performs higher than their usual volume of tasks. For example, an identity typically performs 25 tasks per day, and now it is performing 100 tasks per day.\n-- **Identity Performed Low Number of Tasks**: The identity performs lower than their usual volume of tasks. For example, an identity typically performs 100 tasks per day, and now it is performing 25 tasks per day.\n-- **Identity Performed Tasks with Unusual Results**: The identity performing an action gets a different result than usual, such as most tasks end in a successful result and are now ending in a failed result or vice versa.\n-- **Identity Performed Tasks with Unusual Timing**: The identity does tasks at unusual times as established by their baseline in the observance period. Times are grouped by the following UTC 4-hour windows.\n-- **Identity Performed Tasks with Unusual Types**: The identity performs unusual types of tasks as established by their baseline in the observance period. For example, an identity performs read, write, or delete tasks they wouldn't ordinarily perform.\n-- **Identity Performed Tasks with Multiple Unusual Patterns**: The identity has several unusual patterns in the tasks performed by the identity as established by their baseline in the observance period.\n-\n-Alert triggers are based on data collected. All alerts, if triggered, are shown every hour under the Alerts subtab.\n-\n-## View statistical anomalies in an identity's behavior\n-You can view statistical anomalies in an identity's behavior to monitor unusual activities in Permissions Management. This section explains how to access and interpret the alerts.\n-\n-1. In the Permissions Management home page, select **Alerts** (the bell icon).\n-1. Select **Statistical Anomaly**, and then select the **Alerts** subtab.\n-\n-    The **Alerts** subtab displays the following information:\n-\n-      - **Alert Name**: Lists the name of the alert.\n-      - **Anomaly Alert Rule**: Displays the name of the rule select when creating the alert.\n-      - **# of Occurrences**: Displays how many times the alert trigger has occurred.\n-      - **Authorization System**: Displays which authorization systems the alert applies to.\n-      - **Date/Time**: Lists the day of the outlier occurring.\n-      - **Date/Time (UTC)**: Lists the day of the outlier occurring in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).\n-\n-\n-1. To filter the alerts based on name, select the appropriate alert name or choose **All** from the **Alert Name** dropdown menu, and select **Apply**.\n-1. To filter the alerts based on alert time, select **Last 24 Hours**, **Last 2 Days**, **Last Week**, or **Custom Range** from the **Date** dropdown menu, and select **Apply**.\n-1.  If you select the ellipses (**...**) and select:\n-      - **Details**, this brings you to an Alert Summary view with **Authorization System**, **Statistical Model** and **Observance Period** displayed along with a table with a row per identity triggering this alert. From here you can click:\n-       - **Details**: Displays graph(s) highlighting the anomaly with context, and up to the top 3 actions performed on the day of the anomaly\n-       - **View Trigger**: Displays the current trigger settings and applicable authorization system details\n-      - **View Trigger**: Displays the current trigger settings and applicable authorization system details\n-\n-## Create a statistical anomaly alert trigger\n-You can configure statistical anomaly alert triggers for specific conditions to detect unusual activities. This section guides you through the steps to create these alert triggers.\n-\n-1. In the Permissions Management home page, select **Alerts** (the bell icon).\n-1. Select **Statistical Anomaly**, select the **Alerts** subtab, and then select **Create Alert Trigger**.\n-1. Enter a name for the alert in the **Alert Name** box.\n-1. Select the **Authorization System**, Amazon Web Services (**AWS**), Microsoft **Azure**, or Google Cloud Platform (**GCP**).\n-1. Select one of the following conditions:\n-\n-      - **Identity Performed High Number of Tasks**: The identity performs higher than their usual volume of tasks. For example, an identity typically performs 25 tasks per day, and now it is performing 100 tasks per day.\n-      - **Identity Performed Low Number of Tasks**: The identity performs lower than their usual volume of tasks. For example, an identity typically performs 100 tasks per day, and now it is performing 25 tasks per day.\n-      - **Identity Performed Tasks with Unusual Results**: The identity performing an action gets a different result than usual, such as most tasks end in a successful result and are now ending in a failed result or vice versa.\n-      - **Identity Performed Tasks with Unusual Timing**: The identity does tasks at unusual times as established by their baseline in the observance period. Times are grouped by the following UTC 4 hour windows.\n-           - 12AM-4AM UTC\n-           - 4AM-8AM UTC\n-           - 8AM-12PM UTC\n-           - 12PM-4PM UTC\n-           - 4PM-8PM UTC\n-           - 8PM-12AM UTC\n-      - **Identity Performed Tasks with Unusual Types**: The identity performs unusual types of tasks as established by their baseline in the observance period. For example, an identity performs read, write, or delete tasks they wouldn't ordinarily perform.\n-      - **Identity Performed Tasks with Multiple Unusual Patterns**: The identity has several unusual patterns in the tasks performed by the identity as established by their baseline in the observance period.\n-1. Select **Next**.\n-\n-1. On the **Authorization Systems** tab, select the appropriate systems, or, to select all systems, select **All**.\n-\n-    The screen defaults to the **List** view but you can switch to **Folder** view using the menu, and then select the applicable folder instead of individually by system.\n-\n-     - The **Status** column displays if the authorization system is online or offline.\n-\n-     - The **Controller** column displays if the controller is enabled or disabled.\n-\n-\n-1. Select **Save**.\n-\n-## View statistical anomaly alert triggers\n-You can view and manage the statistical anomaly alert triggers you have created. This section provides instructions on how to access and modify these triggers.\n-\n-1. In the Permissions Management home page, select **Alerts** (the bell icon).\n-1. Select **Statistical Anomaly**, and then select the **Alert Triggers** subtab.\n-\n-    The **Alert Triggers** subtab displays the following information:\n-\n-      - **Alert**: Displays the name of the alert.\n-      - **Anomaly Alert Rule**: Displays the name of the rule select when creating the alert.\n-      - **# of users subscribed**: Displays the number of users subscribed to the alert.\n-      - **Created By**: Displays the email address of the user who created the alert.\n-      - **Last Modified By**: Displays the email address of the user who last modified the alert.\n-      - **Last Modified On**: Displays the date and time the trigger was last modified.\n-      - **Subscription**: Subscribes you to receive alert emails. Toggle the button to **On** or **Off**.\n-\n-1. To filter by **Activated** or **Deactivated**, in the **Status** section, select **All**, **Activated**, or **Deactivated**, and then select **Apply**.\n-\n-1. To view other options available to you, select the ellipses (**...**), and then select from the available options:\n-\n-     If the **Subscription** is **On**, the following options are available:\n-     - **Edit**: Enables you to modify alert parameters\n-\n-        > [!NOTE]\n-          > Only the user who created the alert can perform the following actions: edit the trigger screen, rename an alert, deactivate an alert, and delete an alert. Changes made by other users aren't saved.\n-     - **Duplicate**: Create a duplicate copy of the selected alert trigger.\n-     - **Rename**: Enter the new name of the query, and then select **Save.**\n-     - **Deactivate**: The alert will still be listed, but will no longer send emails to subscribed users.\n-     - **Activate**: Activate the alert trigger and start sending emails to subscribed users.\n-     - **Notification Settings**: View the **Email** of users who are subscribed to the alert trigger.\n-     - **Delete**: Delete the alert.\n-\n-     If the **Subscription** is **Off**, the following options are available:\n-     - **View**: View  details of the alert trigger.\n-     - **Notification settings**: View the **Email** of users who are subscribed to the alert trigger.\n-     - **Duplicate**: Create a duplicate copy of the selected alert trigger.\n-\n-\n-1. Select **Apply**.\n-\n-\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- For an overview on alerts and alert triggers, see [View information about alerts and alert triggers](ui-triggers.md).\n-- For information on activity alerts and alert triggers, see [Create and view activity alerts and alert triggers](how-to-create-alert-trigger.md).\n-- For information on rule-based anomaly alerts and alert triggers, see [Create and view rule-based anomaly alerts and alert triggers](product-rule-based-anomalies.md).\n-- For information on permission analytics alerts and alert triggers, see [Create and view permission analytics alerts and alert triggers](product-permission-analytics.md)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "69b3855fa145b50d24db3a200498cbc0ee7d48a3",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/report-create-custom-report.md",
    "status": "removed",
    "additions": 0,
    "deletions": 125,
    "changes": 125,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Freport-create-custom-report.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Freport-create-custom-report.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Freport-create-custom-report.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,125 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Create, view, and share a custom report a custom report in Permissions Management\n-description: How to create, view, and share a custom report in the Permissions Management.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-# Create, view, and share a custom report\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-This article describes how to create, view, and share a custom report in Permissions Management.\n-\n-## Create a custom report\n-\n-1. In the Permissions Management home page, select the **Reports** tab, and then select the **Custom Reports** subtab.\n-1. Select **New Custom Report**.\n-1. In the **Report Name** box, enter a name for your report.\n-1. From the **Report Based on** list:\n-    1. To view which authorization systems the report applies to, hover over each report name.\n-    1. To view a description of a report, select the report.\n-1. Select a report you want to use as the base for your custom report, and then select **Next**.\n-1. In the **MyReport** box, select the **Authorization System** you want: Amazon Web Services (**AWS**), Microsoft Azure (**Azure**), or Google Cloud Platform (**GCP**).\n-\n-1. To add specific accounts, select the **List** subtab, and then select **All** or the account names.\n-1. To add specific folders, select the **Folders** subtab, and then select **All** or the folder names.\n-\n-1. Select the **Report Format** subtab, and then select the format for your report: comma-separated values (**CSV**) file, portable document format (**PDF**), or Microsoft Excel Open XML Spreadsheet (**XLSX**) file.\n-1. Select the **Schedule** tab, and then select the frequency for your report, from **None** up to **Monthly**.\n-\n-    - For **Hourly** and **Daily** options, set the start date by choosing from the **Calendar** dropdown, and can input a specific time of the day they want to receive the report.\n-\n-    In addition to date and time, the **Weekly** and **Biweekly** provide options for you to select on which day(s)of the week the report should repeat.\n-\n-1. Select **Save**.\n-\n-      The following message displays across the top of the screen in green if the download is successful: **Report has been created**.\n-The report name appears in the **Reports** table.\n-\n-## View a custom report\n-\n-1. In the Permissions Management home page, select the **Reports** tab, and then select the **Custom Reports** subtab.\n-\n-    The **Custom Reports** tab displays the following information in the **Reports** table:\n-\n-    - **Report Name**: The name of the report.\n-    - **Category**: The type of report: **Permission**.\n-    - **Authorization System**: The authorization system in which you can view the report: AWS, Azure, and GCP.\n-    - **Format**: The format of the report, **CSV**, **PDF**, or **XLSX** format.\n-\n-1. To view a report, from the **Report Name** column, select the report you want.\n-1. To download a report, select the down arrow to the right of the report name, or from the ellipses **(...)** menu, select **Download**.\n-1. To refresh the list of reports, select **Reload**.\n-\n-## Share a custom report\n-\n-1. In the Permissions Management home page, select the **Reports** tab, and then select the **Custom Reports** subtab.\n-1. In the **Reports** table, select a report and then select the ellipses (**...**) icon.\n-1. In the **Report Settings** box, select **Share with**.\n-1. In the **Search Email to add** box, enter the name of other Permissions Management user(s).\n-\n-    You can only share reports with other Permissions Management users.\n-1. Select **Save**.\n-\n-## Search for a custom report\n-\n-1. In the Permissions Management home page, select the **Reports** tab, and then select the **Custom Reports** subtab.\n-1. On the **Custom Reports** tab, select **Search**.\n-1. In the **Search** box, enter the name of the report you want.\n-\n-    The **Custom Reports** tab displays a list of reports that match your search criteria.\n-1. Select the report you want.\n-1. To download a report, select the down arrow to the right of the report name, or from the ellipses **(...)** menu, select **Download**.\n-1. To refresh the list of reports, select **Reload**.\n-\n-\n-## Modify a saved or scheduled custom report\n-\n-1. In the Permissions Management home page, select the **Reports** tab, and then select the **Custom Reports** subtab.\n-1. Hover over the report name on the **Custom Reports** tab.\n-\n-    - To rename the report, select **Edit** (the pencil icon), and enter a new name.\n-    - To change the settings for your report, select **Settings** (the gear icon). Make your changes, and then select **Save**.\n-\n-    - To download a copy of the report, select the **Down arrow** icon.\n-\n-1. To perform other actions to the report, select the ellipses (**...**) icon:\n-\n-    - **Download**: Downloads a copy of the report.\n-\n-    - **Report Settings**: Displays the settings for the report, including scheduling, sharing the report, and so on.\n-\n-    - **Duplicate**: Creates a duplicate of the report called **\"Copy of XXX\"**. Any reports not created by the current user are listed as **Duplicate**.\n-\n-         When you select **Duplicate**, a box appears asking if you're sure you want to create a duplicate. Select **Confirm**.\n-\n-         When the report is successfully duplicated, the following message displays: **Report generated successfully**.\n-\n-    - **API Settings**: Download the report using your Application Programming Interface (API) settings.\n-\n-         When this option is selected, the **API Settings** window opens and displays the **Report ID** and **Secret Key**. Select **Generate New Key**.\n-\n-    - **Delete**: Select this option to delete the report.\n-\n-         After selecting **Delete**, a pop-up box appears asking if the user is sure they want to delete the report. Select **Confirm**.\n-\n-        **Report is deleted successfully** appears across the top of the screen in green if successfully deleted.\n-\n-    - **Unsubscribe**: Unsubscribe the user from receiving scheduled reports and notifications.\n-\n-         This option is only available after a report has been scheduled.\n-\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- For information on how to view system reports in the **Reports** dashboard, see [View system reports in the Reports dashboard](product-reports.md).\n-- For a detailed overview of available system reports, see [View a list and description of system reports](all-reports.md).\n-- For information about how to generate and view a system report, see [Generate and view a system report](report-view-system-report.md).\n-- For information about how to create and view the Permissions analytics report, see [Generate and download the Permissions analytics report](product-permissions-analytics-reports.md)."
  },
